headline: Australia’s Waratah Super Battery enters planned shutdown amid transformer replacement efforts
summary_80w: Developer Akaysha Energy has confirmed that the 850MW Waratah Super Battery will undergo a planned balance of plant shutdown from 20 November to 2 December 2025.

headline: Morocco plans to build 30,000MT polysilicon plant
summary_80w: The Moroccan government has announced plans to build a 30,000MT “green polysilicon” production facility, in partnership with Moroccan renewable energy firm GPM Holding.

headline: Australia’s Hydro Tasmania seeks 1,500GWh solar and wind capacity via tender
summary_80w: Hydro Tasmania is seeking expressions of interest for wind and solar projects capable of delivering up to 1,500GWh of renewables annually.

headline: First Solar inaugurates ‘AI-powered’ 3.5GW Louisiana factory
summary_80w: US solar module manufacturer First Solar has inaugurated its 3.5GW vertically integrated manufacturing facility in the state of Louisiana, the company’s fifth factory in the US.

headline: Indian railways award 1GW of renewables capacity in latest tender
summary_80w: India’s Railway Energy Management Company (REMC) has awarded 1GW of contracts to supply the railway network with round-the-clock (RTC) renewable energy.

headline: Adapting solar project economics in a low energy price environment
summary_80w: PV Talk: RES Group's Ksenia Dray discusses how European solar developers are reshaping strategies to maintain project viability in challenging market conditions.

headline: Italy’s MACSE and the evolution of BESS asset management in Europe
summary_80w: The low prices and strict operational requirements in Italy's recent MACSE auction for BESS have brought asset management and operational execution into the spotlight.

headline: Who won at the Energy Storage Awards 2025?
summary_80w: Fluence, Energy Dome and EDF each scored consecutive wins in prestigious categories at the Energy Storage Awards 2025 in London.

headline: FRV submits 200MW solar-plus-storage development to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Fotowatio Renewable Ventures (FRV) Australia has submitted an environmental referral for a 200MW solar PV project paired with a 550MW/2,200MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in New South Wales.

headline: CPS Energy issues request for proposals for 600MW of Texas solar capacity

headline: BNZ starts operations at 150MW Spanish solar PV portfolio

summary_80w: JUWI, a wholly-owned subsidiary of MVV Energie AG, has completed the sale of a 156MW solar PV portfolio in Greece to Mirova, an affiliate of Natixis Investment Managers specialising in sustainable investing.

headline: Germany’s first grid-balancing solar project might be a ‘paradigm shift’ for energy
summary_80w: A modestly sized solar PV project in central Germany might have just ushered in a new era of renewables’ relationship with the grid.

headline: IKEA investment arm enters Indian solar market via 210MW ib vogt partnership
summary_80w: ib vogt has entered a strategic partnership with Ingka Investments for a 210MW solar project in Rajasthan, India.

headline: Is AI’s power problem becoming the US energy storage market’s golden opportunity?
summary_80w: The development of data centres has emerged as a possible lifeline for ongoing projects in the battery energy storage system (BESS) industry.

headline: Santa Cruz County publishes draft BESS zoning ordinance, officials delay environmental review by another three months

headline: VIDEO: Surviving energy storage nightmares – true tales and expert advice
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with GridBeyond, Surviving Energy Storage Nightmares: True Tales and Expert Advice.

headline: European BESS M&A and financings totalling over 1GW
summary_80w: In a major week for European BESS deal-making, project acquisition and financing deals have been done in the Poland, Germany, Finland, the UK and Romania for grid-scale projects totalling well over 1GW of capacity.

headline: Australia’s solar paradox: Record 5.3GW installations in 2024 cannot crack global top ten
summary_80w: Australia achieved a record-breaking 5.3GW of solar PV installations in 2024, marking a recovery for the market while highlighting the nation's unique position as a rooftop-dominated solar economy.

headline: Arevon Energy breaks ground on 124MW Big Muddy solar project in Illinois
summary_80w: US independent power producer (IPP) Arevon Energy has begun construction on a 124MW solar PV project in Illinois, its first utility-scale project in the state.

headline: CFM starts operations at Colombian solar plant, invests in neighbouring solar-plus-storage project

summary_80w: PV Talk: India’s race to 500GW of clean energy is being slowed by critical bottlenecks. NTPC PMI’s deputy general manager Abhinav Jindal tells Shreeyashi Ojha what steps India must urgently take to stay on track with its 2030 targets.

headline: German PV plant becomes first prequalified to provide secondary control power

The industry first, a collaboration between Enerparc subsidiary Sunnic Lighthouse, Entelios and transmission system operator 50Hertz, demonstrates the potential for PV systems to provide grid stability services alongside renewable energy generation. The 37.4MWp Enerparc facility in Schkölen began commercial participation […]

headline: VIDEO: Inside CAN networks – Solving core communication challenges in co-located renewables and BESS

headline: Corning holds the key to US-made wafer supply

headline: Australia eyes solar independence with first domestic ingot and wafer production

summary_80w: The three-year rolling partnership, whereby CATL will supply HyperStrong with cells and system products, could be updated annually.

headline: How important is cell-to-ESS vertical integration?
